Description: Rim sherd (mended from two fragments) of Attic black-figured pottery dinos stand; interior: top glazed, reserved below; exterior: torus mouldings glazed; between them, black-figure decoration consisting of frieze of ducks (six preserved) to right; added red on wings and blobs as filling ornament. A worn ring on the glaze on the top seems caused by much use.
Producer name: Attributed to the Circle of: Sophilos
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1888,0601.570.a, 1888,0601.570.b, 1888,0601.570.c, 1888,0601.570.g and 1965,0930.759.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 480, no. B837)
Williams 1983 / Sophilos in the British Museum (p. 13, p. 15)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 225, no 7a)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0272) (Phase 1)
